intro: Spermacoce ramanii, commonly known as the Raman's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it has opposite, narrow leaves. Spermacoce ramanii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its fruit is a small, two-chambered capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
